埃布尔看起来比他的实际年龄要大，在他原本灰色的头发中很少有黑色的痕迹，他的脸上有一种苦恼的表情。他的衣服和手指都沾满了墨水。
Ebder是一个会说普通话的{@creature commoner}，并有一套{@item calligrapher's supplies|PHB}。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "我是一个焦虑的人。我担心高级抄写员（%0%）对我和我的工作有什么看法。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "衡量一个人的标准是其工作的质量"。

entries.name: Bond
entries: "尽管我很关心我作为一个阿维德人的职责，但我的女儿是我的世界。"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "我对其他人的动机高度怀疑。"

entries.name: Gailby Smallstone
entries: {@i Lawful good human child (age 8)}
盖尔比是一个精力充沛的孩子，与她的父亲艾伯德-斯莫斯通住在萤火虫酒窖里。她喜欢画画，并坚持在睡前与父亲分享她的画。
她穿着一件黄色的连帽斗篷，掩盖了她的黑色卷曲短发，并且缺少一颗门牙。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "我对一切都很好奇。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "只要我有想象力，我就不会感到无聊。"

entries.name: Bond
entries: "我喜欢自己发现东西，尤其是那些不受限制的东西"。

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "为了避免惹上麻烦，我什么都会说。"

entries.name: K'Tulah
entries: {@i Neutral good tabaxi scholar (age 30)}
{@creature K'Tulah|CM}是一个好客的Tabaxi，一种类似猫的人形生物。她在六天前到达烛台镇，并得到许可使用图书馆来进行她对地区性民间魔法形式的研究。
她是一个活跃的谈话者，她在聊天时夸张的手势让人讨厌（%0%），但精灵很欣赏她的学术专长。
{@creature K'Tulah|CM}是一个tabaxi {@creature druid}，有以下变化。

items: (她能说普通话和德鲁伊语，而且她有{@sense darkvision}60英尺以外的范围。
当{@creature K'Tulah|CM}在她的战斗回合中移动时，她的速度可以加倍，直到回合结束。一旦她使用这个能力，她就不能再使用它，直到她在某个回合中移动0英尺。
作为一个动作，{@creature K'Tulah|CM}可以用她的爪子进行一次近战武器攻击。命中率+2，范围5英尺，一个目标。{@i Hit}: 2 ({@dice 1d4})砍击伤害。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "我说话很快，几乎可以就任何事情进行交谈。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "礼节被高估了。生活中的礼节太短了"。

entries.name: Bond
entries: "我在过去十年中苦心收集的研究是我的骄傲和快乐。"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "我不喜欢被困住的感觉。"

entries.name: Crinkle
entries: {@i Chaotic neutral kenku custodian (age 55)}
在过去的二十二年里，这只年迈的Kenku一直住在萤火虫地窖里，作为其监护人和萤火虫的看护人。她已经失去了许多羽毛，剩下的那些羽毛也被折断了，变得凌乱不堪。她拿着一根末端有钩子的长杖，用它来更换悬挂在天花板上的萤火虫灯。
克林克对其他人没有什么耐心，她把高级文士{@creature Varnyr|CM}的修复工作视为一种入侵。盖尔比-斯莫尔斯通用她对有趣物品的欣赏软化了这个肯库的沉闷性格。
克林克是一个{@creature kenku}，他有一个{@item ring of the ram}，拥有所有的电荷。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "我是一个脾气暴躁的人，更喜欢一个人待着。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "我被美丽而有趣的艺术作品所吸引"。

entries.name: Bond
entries: "我很珍惜我所积累的小饰品和宝物的储藏室。"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "我不断地揉搓我的双手，仿佛是在清洗它们。"

entries.name: Starting the Adventure
entries: 冒险发生在安息之家下面的萤火虫地窖里。角色可能会因为以下两个原因之一而被吸引到这个地方。也许是安息之家涌入了大量的客人，角色们被迫住在唯一可用的房间里，而这些房间恰好就在萤火虫地窖里。或者，在图书馆的一个实际部分住宿，靠近古书收藏，可能是一个足以让人物留在那里的理由。
角色们通过{@area area F1|1cb|x}天花板上的舱口进入萤火虫地窖。当他们这样做的时候，把F1区的描述读给玩家听。
当他们到达时，他们发现年长的精灵（%0%）在一个梯子上不稳定地平衡着，同时在一个书柜的顶部摆放着几个花盆。她正全神贯注于她的工作。在这些人物说什么之前，她开始说话，没有看他们。
"艾伯德，你回来了吗？"
"我从来没有离开过！"下面传来一个声音抱怨道。
"哦？" 小精灵低头看了看，似乎对你的出现感到惊讶。然后她说，指了指她周围的房间，"啊，访客。我是Scribe（%0%）。对事情的状况感到抱歉。如你所见，修复项目正在进行中。我很快就会和你们在一起。" 她回到了她的工作中。过了一会儿，她说："实际上，你介意把那堆书带到楼下的埃布尔德吗？我在那里等你。" 她指了指凳子上的一小堆书。"太感谢了。"
下楼到（%0%）的人物发现埃布尔坐在桌前，蜷缩在一本书上。他显然很恼火，对人物承认如下。
"请小声点。我刚刚把我女儿放到床上。"
如果被问及，埃布尔会说出自己的名字。如果人物把这堆书交给他，他就捏着鼻梁叹气，并解释说这些书不是给他的，而是给另一位住在下面一个房间的客人（%0%）的。他给这些人物指明了去她房间的方向（{@area area F13|1eb|x}），并要求他们把书送到。
如果他们同意，{@creature K'Tulah|CM}就会感谢他们的交付，并开始谈论她的学术工作。
一小时后，{@creature Varnyr|CM}找到了这些人物，并抱歉地说，她一天的工作已经很累了，他们明天早上再谈。她提供了{@area F8|1df|x}和{@area F12|1e9|x}两个区域作为房间，让这些人物过夜。在她身后的是Crinkle，他为他们准备了一盘食物。就这样，{@creature Varnyr|CM}向他们道了晚安，并让这些人物独自离开。
角色们可以在图书馆周围看看，与艾伯德多聊几个小时，或者回自己的房间去。埃布尔并不善于交谈，但如果有人问起他的女儿盖尔比，他就会热情起来。

entries.name: Events
entries: 下面是对冒险过程中发生的六个事件的详细介绍。

entries.name: Event 1: Quarantined

entries: 在萤火虫酒窖的第一个晚上之后，你们围着酒窖主楼中央的一张桌子。这里很安静，直到你注意到你的同伴们在口中哼着旋律--从你醒来后就一直停留在你的脑海中的同一首曲子。过了一会儿，你意识到你也在跟着哼唱。
这些人物正在哼唱{@creature Shemshime|CM}的韵律。他们不知道它的名字，虽然他们都哼得很好，但他们并不完全确定他们在今天之前就知道它。角色们不知道，当盖尔比-斯莫斯通从克林克那里听到后，在角色们房间外的大厅里唱起了这首被诅咒的曲子，就传到了他们那里。
{@creature K'Tulah|CM}和Ebder与人物同桌而坐。Ebder正在读他昨晚的那本书。嗡嗡声显然困扰着他，过了一会儿，他严厉地要求人物在图书馆里保持安静。如果人物试图停止哼唱，他们注意到没有意识的努力是做不到的（见"{@area Resisting the Rhyme|188|x}"）。
几分钟后，埃布尔也开始哼唱这段旋律，尽管他一开始并没有意识到这一点。几分钟后，上层天花板上的舱门({@area area F1|1cb|x})关上了，接着是几把机械锁啮合的声音。(这个地方的高级Avowed（%%1%）已经锁上了舱门，把她自己、人物、Ebder、Gailby、（%%2%）和Crinkle封在了萤火虫地窖里。
当她走下螺旋形的楼梯来到{@area area F2|1cf|x}时，她用柔和的声音哼唱着被诅咒的曲子。经过努力，{@creature Varnyr|CM}抑制住了她的哼唱，并分享了以下信息。
"当我第一次来到烛台镇时，阿维德人对一种'疯狂歌唱'感到担忧。一个书商被它折磨得死去活来，在几个阿凡提人也开始唱这首歌之后，他被隔离了。" 她停顿了一下，皱起眉头。"我不知道他或其他人发生了什么。那是六百年前的事了。"
她收拾好心情，补充说："我已经提醒了阿沃德，并封住了出口，以阻止这东西的扩散。"
{@creature K'Tulah|CM}直言不讳地表示她对被禁锢在这里感到不舒服。艾伯德认为隔离是个小麻烦，并抱怨说所有的骚动都干扰了他的工作。克林克尔和盖尔比不在。
(%0%）拒绝猜测 "疯狂"，因为她不是施法者，不想在没有证据的情况下猜测原因。"但也许你能在这一切中找到答案，"她说，向凌乱的房间挥手。
角色们可以探索萤火虫酒窖并与居民交谈。当他们这样做的时候，强调需要集中精力，抵制哼唱旋律。
当你认为合适的时候，介绍（%0%）。

entries.name: Talking to the Residents
entries: 萤火虫酒窖的每个居民都提供了他们自己的信息和观点。

entries.name: Crinkle
entries: 萤火虫酒窖的管家正在厨房里（{@area area F7|1dc|x}）准备早餐。她心不在焉地吹着口哨，唱着旋律。如果有人物接近她，她会不屑一顾，如果他们纠缠她，她会变得很烦躁。

entries.name: Ebder
entries: 他仍然在书堆里，坐在桌子旁。如果被人物询问，他说他一直在剧本室工作（{@area area F3|1d1|x}）。没有什么是不正常的，除非你算上那个Kenku，她在往返于她的供应柜的路上一直在那个房间里晃悠。

entries.name: Gailby
entries: 她在她的房间里({@area area F9|1e1|x})。如果人物接近她，她更喜欢炫耀她的玩具而不是回答问题。如果她被问及她的画，她会害怕自己有麻烦而变得安静。

entries.name: K'Tulah
entries: 在书堆里呆了一个小时后，可以在她的房间里找到塔巴希（{@area area F13|1eb|x}）。她很难集中精力工作，而且明显地焦虑不安。如果有人来找她，她会告诉他们她是来学习的，而不是来被封在坟墓里的。

entries.name: Varnyr
entries: 这位高级抄写员在书堆里呆了一个小时，然后才回到她的房间（（%0%））。她已经分享了她所知道的关于影响他们的诅咒的一切。如果被问及她最近在做什么，她解释说，她一直在把时间分给修缮阳台层和在装订车间工作，修理书籍。她能够抑制住哼唱旋律的冲动，没有任何胁迫的外在表现。

entries.name: Exit Hatch
entries: 舱门已被一个{@spell arcane lock}的法术锁定，可以通过使用{@creature Varnyr|CM}持有的钥匙来驱除。舱门有AC21，60点命中率，对毒药和精神伤害有免疫力。拥有盗贼工具的角色可以绕过咒语，通过成功的DC25灵巧检查打开舱门，但每次尝试绕过咒语需要1分钟。或者，一个角色可以通过成功的DC25力量（（%2%））检查来强制打开舱门。一个{@spell knock}的咒语或类似的魔法可以抑制舱门的{@spell arcane lock}咒语，持续10分钟。

entries.caption: Shemshime's Influence
rows: 在接下来的10分钟里，灯里的所有萤火虫不定期地闪灭，让图书馆每次都处于黑暗之中几秒钟。
随机书籍从书架上飞出。在{@area areas F1|1cb|x}、{@area F2|1cf|x}或{@area F14|1ee|x}的每个生物都必须在DC13的灵巧救赎中成功，否则就会因为与飞来的书籍相撞而受到2({@dice 1d4})的重击伤害。
图书馆变得更冷了。这种温度的下降一直持续到冒险的结束。
三个{@creature Shadow||shadows}出现在与角色相同的区域。这些影子会攻击角色，但在战斗的第三个回合结束时，如果它们还没有被消灭，则会消失。

{@creature Shemshime|CM}的污秽魔法表现为一个随机角色的最糟糕的噩梦。该角色必须做一个DC12的智力救赎动作。如果救赎失败，该角色会受到9({@dice 2d8})的精神伤害，并且是{@condition frightened}的表现，相信它是真的。表现出来的恶梦持续时间长达1分钟，跟随角色到处走动，并且不能被伤害。角色必须在每个回合结束时重复蓄力，如果成功则结束幻觉，如果蓄力失败则受到9（%3%）的精神伤害。
在萤火虫地窖中选择三个生物。每一个都必须在DC14智慧救赎中成功，否则就会受到7({@dice 1d8 + 3})的精神伤害，并对你选择的一个生物进行近战武器攻击作为反应。

entries.name: Event 2: Ebder's Outburst
entries: 当此事件发生时，Ebder坐在{@area area F2|1cf|x}的桌子旁。
一个尖锐的声音撕裂了萤火虫酒窖，压倒了所有其他噪音。虽然它迅速上升到一个不可思议的音调，但你认出了埃布尔的声音。
任何在（%0%）的人都能看到埃布尔的眼睛因恐惧而鼓起。当他哼唱韵律的旋律时，他身体的其他部分是（%1%）。他摸起来很冷。他继续一遍又一遍地唱着这首儿歌，持续了5分钟。在这期间，盖尔比跑进房间，试图帮助她的父亲，被他的行为吓坏了。克林克尔跟着她，试图安慰孩子，但效果甚微。
{@creature Shemshime|CM}的影响力已经开始深入到这个世界。当Ebder停止唱歌时，在{@creature Shemshime|CM}的影响力表上滚动，看看接下来会发生什么。

entries.name: Haunting Occurrences
entries: 在埃布尔的爆发之后，{@creature Shemshime|CM}的影响在萤火虫酒窖里以几种令人不安的方式表现出来。从此以后，只要至少有一半的角色在唱（%%1%）的韵律，就在（%%2%）的影响表上滚动，以决定发生什么。在你认为合适的时候，甚至在以后的事件中，都可以增加这些卷轴。

entries.name: Event 3: Singing Skull
entries: 把书和它的诅咒带到烛台镇的卖书人尤文-皮尔特的遗体被藏在{@area area F4|1d4|x}的一个秘密隔间里。当他的头骨开始唱起韵律诗的歌词时，这个事件就开始了。
这首曲子继续牵动着你们每个人的心，愿意你们去吟唱它的音符序列。这些音符呈现出你肯定以前从未听过的单词的形状，但不知何故，你对歌词很熟悉。
与你的队员们分享{@creature Shemshime|CM}的{@area handout|180|x}的韵律。讲义中没有最后一节。今后，每当一个角色被迫哼唱{@creature Shemshime|CM}的韵律时，他们就会唱出这首曲子的歌词来代替。
你开始意识到，这首歌不仅在你的脑子里。在附近的某个地方，一个低沉而悠扬的声音正在唱着这些话。
头骨会继续唱歌，除非它被摧毁或{@creature Shemshime|CM}被困于{@i Shemshime's Bedtime Rhyme}。头骨是一个小型物体，AC值为15，命中率为4，对毒药伤害免疫。

entries.name: Event 4: Escape Attempt
entries: {@creature K'Tulah|CM}对被禁锢的忍耐达到了极限，她试图打破隔离区。这个事件可以在任何地区开始。
当你准备开始这项活动时，请大声朗读以下方框内的文字。
{@creature K'Tulah|CM}，咬着嘴唇不让自己唱歌，背靠着墙，双手抱头，瘫倒在地。过了一会儿，她的耳朵变平了，她弹了起来，全力冲刺。

{@creature K'Tulah|CM}跑向{@area area F1|1cb|x}天花板上的舱口。她试图躲避任何挡在她面前的人，但必要时与他们战斗。如果她到达舱口，她会试图强行打开门。当这不起作用时，她要求{@creature Varnyr|CM}打开它，但{@creature Varnyr|CM}拒绝了。除非{@creature K'Tulah|CM}被制服，否则她会攻击{@creature Varnyr|CM}以获得钥匙。
一个角色可以尝试安抚{@creature K'Tulah|CM}，通过成功的DC15魅力({@skill Persuasion})检查来做到这一点。一个{@spell calm emotions}的咒语或类似的魔法也能起到作用，就像给{@creature K'Tulah|CM}她宿舍里的机械牡蛎({@area area F13|1eb|x})。

entries.name: Event 5: Puppets
entries: 这个事件可以发生在任何区域，除了Crinkle的房间（（%0%））。
你周围的空气感觉很厚。它从四面八方向你压来，刺痛你的神经。你的肌肉抽搐，仿佛有什么东西在用无形的绳索拉扯着它们。
当这个事件开始时，辛克尔和盖尔比逃到辛克尔的房间（F11区）。

选择剩下的一半角色，包括NPC（除盖尔比和克林克尔外）。那些没有受到{@spell protection from evil and good}法术或类似魔法影响的人，必须在DC15魅力救赎中成功，否则就会被{@condition charmed}的{@creature Shemshime|CM}控制1分钟。在{@condition charmed}这种方式下，该生物会被{@creature Shemshime|CM}控制，并被强迫反复唱{@creature Shemshime|CM}的韵律，同时试图对他人造成身体伤害。
行为和动作被{@creature Shemshime|CM}控制的生物仍然知道它们周围发生了什么，但它们无力阻止自己按照{@creature Shemshime|CM}的意愿造成伤害。

{@creature Shemshime|CM}对生物的控制会被{@spell dispel evil and good}法术（可能超出人物能力的魔法）的破除魔法效果所打破，或者被降低生物的命中率至0。一个{@condition charmed}的生物可以在它的每个回合结束时重复蓄力，如果成功则结束对自己的影响。如果一个生物救赎成功或效果结束，{@creature Shemshime|CM}在24小时内不能再次控制该生物。

entries.name: Event 6: Shemshime
entries: 最后的事件是围绕着与书的互动和学习韵文的最后一节，它告诉我们如何挫败（%0%）和结束诅咒。同时，(1%)凝聚在书的周围，向人物发难，阻止他们挫败其表现。
随着活动5的结束，阅读或转述。
盖尔比出现在门口，脸上和衣服前面都溅上了血。她浑身发抖，眼睛瞪得大大的，手里拿着一本方形的大书，金属书脊的一角上有血迹。
盖尔比手中的书是（%0%）。尽管盖尔比不愿意分享真相，但她承认她用这本书敲了克里克尔（%1%）。当事情发生时，要么是她，要么是Cinkle被附身了，但盖尔比不确定是哪一个。

entries.name: Repairing the Music Box
entries: {@i Shemshime's Bedtime Rhyme}的关键特征是它的音乐盒，几个世纪前就坏了。它不是一直在演奏曲子，而是在接近尾声时跳过，重新开始。当这本书被打开时，弹出的场景也是如此。
盒子外部的损坏对检查它的人来说是很明显的。一个成功的DC15智力检查可以发现问题。任何精通珠宝商工具或工匠工具的人都有优势。音乐盒里有一个黄铜圆柱体，上面点缀着小钉子。当圆筒转动时，狭窄的金属碎片拨动钉子，产生旋律的音符。圆筒是歪着坐的，这使它不能正常工作。修复音乐盒需要三次成功的DC15灵巧检查，每次检查都需要一个动作。这些检查可以由一个角色或多个角色共同完成。
试图修复音乐盒的角色会在脑海中听到{@creature Shemshime|CM}令人抓狂的低语。在进行修复音乐盒的能力检查后，无论检查是否成功，角色都必须进行DC13智力救赎，救赎失败会受到14({@dice 4d6})的精神伤害，救赎成功则受到一半的伤害。
一旦固定下来，音乐盒就会把它的曲子弹到最后。当它这样做时，韵律的最后一节的词在人物的脑海中形成（见"（%0%）"）。书中播放的场景也延续到了最后，显示了{@creature Shemshime|CM}被压在磨石下的微小表现。

entries.name: Confrontation
entries: 唱最后一节的时候，把（%0%）吸引到房间里。
书在颤抖，它的机械内部运作在呼啸着恢复生机之前吱吱作响，停了一会儿。你听到咔嚓声，影子从书中迸发出来，就像水壶里的蒸汽，沿着天花板聚集，直到几缕黑暗勾勒出一个模糊的人形。与此同时，书中的场景发生了变化，创造出一幅全新的画面，其中包括你们自己的小剪影。
{@creature Shemshime|CM}攻击人物，把注意力集中在靠近书的人身上。它还试图破坏人物的注意力，因为它在唱出韵律时获得了力量。
书中新形成的插图展示了萤火虫酒窖的传真，上面有人物和NPC的小剪影。场景中值得注意的是悬挂在书堆上方天花板上的巨大雕塑的复制品（关于雕塑的描述见（%0%））。

entries.name: Destroying the Book
entries: 毁掉这本书对打败或阻碍{@creature Shemshime|CM}没有任何作用。(%%1%)是一个微小的物体，AC为14，命中率为15，伤害阈值为15（见(%%2%)中的(%%3%)），对毒药和精神伤害免疫。

entries.name: Defeating Shemshime
entries: 要打败{@creature Shemshime|CM}，它必须被一个至少1000磅重的物体压碎。萤火虫地窖中符合条件的物体包括悬挂在天花板上的书本雕塑（%1%），F1和F2区域的书柜，以及（%2%）的石桌。
把{@creature Shemshime|CM}引到它可以被压碎的地方需要一些努力。因为{@creature Shemshime|CM}对这本书念念不忘，所以无论谁拥有这本书，灵魂都会追随。换句话说，人物可以用书本身来引诱{@creature Shemshime|CM}受到伤害。
一旦{@creature Shemshime|CM}就位，角色可以使用一个动作，将一个重物掉落或倾倒在上面。{@creature Shemshime|CM}必须在DC15的灵巧救赎中成功，以避免被压在物体下。如果救赎失败，{@creature Shemshime|CM}就会消失，并出现以下结果之一。

items: 如果书是完整的，{@creature Shemshime|CM}就会被拽回书中。它被关上，使音乐盒安静下来，结束诅咒。
如果书已经被毁，{@creature Shemshime|CM}会被拉到最近的一本封闭的书中，结束诅咒。那本书会转变为{@i Shemshime's Bedtime Rhyme}的副本，在这个过程中破坏了书的原始内容。

entries: 一旦{@creature Shemshime|CM}再次被困住，{@creature Varnyr|CM}或拥有钥匙的人就会打开F1区的舱门。{@creature Varnyr|CM}或Ebder立即拿着书，把它锁在Candlekeep的一个安全库里。

entries.name: Reward
entries: 阿凡提给人物一个{@item bag of holding}作为打败{@creature Shemshime|CM}的奖励。

entries.name: Troubleshooting
entries: 这个冒险假设隔离区保持完好。但你的游戏中的人物有可能想要离开萤火虫地窖的范围，甚至帮助（%0%）逃跑。这取决于你是否允许这样做，并考虑Candlekeep如何回应。
如果人物在研究书架上的书时陷入了困境，就在（%0%）上滚动，以保持一种危险感。

entries.name: The Firefly Cellar
entries: 被称为 "萤火虫地窖 "的地下室图书馆位于安息之家下面。它完全在地面以下，包含了一些古老的手稿，主要集中在游记和地区习俗方面。在高级文士（%0%）发起修复工作之前，它的书籍在过去几个世纪中基本上被忽视了。

entries.name: Encounter Locations F1-F7
entries: 萤火虫酒窖有三层。上面两层是藏书。尽管年代久远，地窖看起来保存得很好，光滑的石墙和破旧的木质地板，这里和那里都铺着新地毯。唯一的入口是一个镶嵌在天花板上的金属橙色舱门，位于楼梯的顶部，通往F1区。
底层有一个厨房和生活区。多年来，辛克尔是唯一的住户，但在最近的修复工作中，{@creature Varnyr|CM}、艾伯德和盖尔比也搬了进来。
萤火虫酒窖没有窗户。除非另有说明，否则橙金色的光线是从镶嵌在墙壁凹槽中或悬挂在固定装置上的萤火虫瓶子里发出的。
以下是萤火虫酒窖地图上的关键位置。

entries.name: F1. The Stacks, Balcony

entries: 圆形的房间里有弯曲的深色木质书架，上面挤满了各种形状、大小和年龄的书籍。书架顶上摆放着陶瓷盆中的鲜花，给这个区域带来了甜美的香味。房间周围的凹槽以一定的间隔排列。其中四个摆放着面容姣好的学者的青铜雕像，三个摆放着长满绒毛的椅子。在房间的中央，一个黄铜栏杆围绕着一个俯瞰台，可以看到书库的下层。
在地板上的开口上方，悬挂着一个巨大的石雕，是一本打开的书，看起来就像封面在拍打，以保持它的高耸。东边有一个螺旋形的楼梯通向下面，也通向设置在天花板上的活板门出口。偶尔会有失误的萤火虫飞来飞去。
{@creature Varnyr|CM}的修复项目从这个房间开始，它比下面的房间更整洁、更温馨。她带来了地毯和鲜花，并擦亮了雕像。其中三座雕像的状态很差，她用舒适的阅读椅代替了它们。
书柜有10英尺高，每个书柜都有一个新的滚动梯子连接着。
从阳台可以看到F2区。

entries.name: Book Lift
entries: 在栏杆上固定着一个绳索和滑轮装置，一端是一个磨损的篮子。几个世纪前，阿沃夫人把它放在这里，以便在楼层之间移动书籍。它本质上是一个大盖子的柳条篮子，可以降低或提高。它的状况不是最好的，所以它最多只能容纳50磅而不会散架。目前箱子被抬起来了，绳子被绑在栏杆上。
搜索书中的人物解除发现两个小的儿童娃娃。一个有一把镰刀，手柄是用圆形画笔做的，刀刃是用纸剪的。另一个娃娃的脚不见了。

entries.name: Flying Book Sculpture
entries: 这块石头的宽度为12英尺，重达1500磅。盖子上刻有 "警惕 "的字样。它被三条铁链悬挂在F2区的上方，但铁链在上方天花板横梁上的配件已经破损。如果在雕塑的重量上再加上200磅或更多，铁链就会从天花板上脱落，雕塑就会掉下来。或者，用足够的力量击打铁链，使其断裂，也会使其倒下。每条链子都有AC19，5点命中率，对毒药和精神伤害免疫。

entries.name: F2. The Stacks

entries: 这里的空气中弥漫着旧书的霉味。同心环形的书柜占据了整个空间，一张沉重的花岗岩桌子占据了房间的中心。这张桌子本来是一个圆形，但在它的边缘有六个半圆形的空隙，为六把椅子创造了空间。桌子上放着小堆的书，还有一个烛台，里面放着装满萤火虫的瓶子。
萤火虫酒窖的一般学习区鼓励安静的阅读。桌子的形状创造了六个独立的学习空间。桌子大约有300磅重，下面放着四张卷起的靛蓝地毯。{@creature Varnyr|CM}打算用15英尺长、5英尺宽的地毯作为这层楼的北、东、南、西过道的跑道。
这些书柜有10英尺高。其中两个有连接的滚动梯子。一个没有连接的梯子靠在房间西南方的书架上。
抬头一看，人物可以看到F1区和悬在头顶的巨大石雕书。

entries.name: F3. Scriptorium

entries: 周围，萤火虫像空气中的余烬一样懒洋洋地飘来飘去。三张写字台靠着北墙，每张写字台下有一张羊皮地毯。其中一张桌子上放着一本书，旁边是一叠纸，还有一个带塞的墨水瓶和一支豪猪羽毛笔。另一张桌子上有一个皮箱。西边的墙上挂着一幅发霉的挂毯，偏离中心。东南面是一堵木板墙，墙内有一扇紧闭的门。从这扇门下发出微弱的黄色光芒。
这个房间是专门用来复印图书馆的文本的。这三张桌子质量很好，但可以进行维修。艾伯德在这里工作，为被认为无法修复的书籍制作新的副本。桌子上的书有一个书签从书页中探出头来。这是一本古老的巨著，它的标题随着时间的推移而被磨损。如果它被打开，书页就会掉出来。另一张桌子上的皮箱里有一套（%0%）。
木板墙上的门用挂锁锁住了。克林克有钥匙，但只是勉强交出，解释说萤火虫不应该被打扰。角色可以通过DC15的灵巧检查来开锁，也可以把它毁掉。这把锁有AC19，5点命中率，对毒药和精神伤害免疫。

entries.name: Writing on the Wall
entries: 任何在挂毯后面寻找的人都会发现刻在石壁上的文字--除了最后一节，{@creature Shemshime|CM}的歌词都是押韵的。它们是由尤文-皮尔特刻的，他因为疯了而被封在这个房间里。

entries.name: F4. Firefly Room

entries: 这个小房间充斥着成千上万只萤火虫的光芒。这些发光的昆虫在沿墙的架子上摆满了十几个玻璃陶罐中飞来飞去。它们在玻璃上弹跳，发出稳定的叮当声。最下面的架子上放着浅浅的木箱。
这个房间以前是剧本室的供应柜，被辛克尔改装过，用于饲养和照料萤火虫。最下面的架子上的箱子里装的是昆虫的液体营养瓶。

entries.name: Writing on the Floor
entries: 成功通过DC12智慧({@skill Perception})检查后，可以看到地板上划着的字。这些字用狂躁的字体写着："完成节奏"。

entries.name: Secret Compartment
entries: 地板上有一块松动的石头，位于东墙最低的架子下面。找到它需要成功地进行DC20智力（（%0%））检查。如果房间里有歌声传出（见{@area event 2|1b6|x}），则DC为10。把石头移到一边，在一个5英尺宽、5英尺深的角落里露出一堆骨头。调查这些骨头时发现了两具人形的尸体。其中一个头骨的后面有一个洞。这是Yowen Pilt，被一个急于结束诅咒的Avowed杀死。那位 "神通者 "也受到了诅咒的影响，为了阻止它的蔓延而自杀了。尸体被藏在这个柜子里。

entries.name: F5. Bindery

entries: 皮革碎片、木屑和纸屑散落在一个大工作台附近的地板上。工具和装置整齐地摆放在少数几本处于不同失修状态的书籍周围。凳子围绕着长椅，其中一个凳子上还披着一条皮革围裙。
需要修理的书籍被送到装订厂。{@creature Varnyr|CM}喜欢这项工作，长椅上展示的就是她的作品。这些工具用于书籍装订、皮革加工、木雕和绘画。
凳子上放着一个账本。账本上有四个书名，每个书名旁边都有一个 "需要维修 "的条目。这些书名及其相关的维修情况如下。
{@i Festivals and Festivities of Ancient Cormyr}: 更换盖子
{@i Living a Dream: Three Years Among Stone Giants}: 更换盖子
{@i Shemshime's Bedtime Rhyme}: 修复脊柱
{@i Halfling Superstitions}: 重新绑定
通过DC12智慧（{@skill Perception}）或智力（{@skill Investigation}）检查成功的角色注意到，工作台的书是清单上的三本。{@i Shemshime's Bedtime Rhyme}不见了。

entries.name: F6. The Worm Tunnel
entries: 这条通道可以从{@area area F2|1cf|x}的西边的楼梯进入。
这里很冷。一个低矮的桶形拱顶挤满了本已狭窄的通道。挂在墙上的一个钩子上的萤火虫灯的光线不足以照亮整个空间。
这条幽闭的走廊在书堆下面，通向生活区。在远处的尽头是一扇关闭但未上锁的门。通道两侧每隔10英尺就有一盏灯挂在钩子上，但只有一盏灯，大约在通道的一半处，发出光。其他灯的底部都堆着死萤火虫。

entries.name: F7. Kitchen

entries: 一个脏兮兮的平底锅在原本一尘不染的厨房中显得格外显眼，空气中弥漫的熏肉味暗示着平底锅以前的内容。东南角的一扇门挂着一条缝。
一个烤箱占据了一个角落；它没有被明火加热，而是有一个被施了{@spell heat metal}咒语的铁线圈，当烤箱侧面的切换开关被打开时，它就会启动。另一个角落里放着一个储藏丰富的储藏室。锅碗瓢盆挂在金属水槽上方的墙钩上。
东南面的门通向一条走廊，连接到F8至F14区域。

entries.name: F8. Avowed Quarters

entries: 在一个光秃秃的房间里，两张床摆在对面的墙上，侧面是一个洗脸盆。两张床都是铺好的，但其中一张床上的毯子有点褶皱。
在过去，这个房间里会有两个阿沃德，但现在几乎没有人使用。如果人物在地窖里过夜，这就是他们的一个房间。否则，这个房间是无人居住的。

entries.name: F9. Gailby's Room
entries: 这个房间的门是开着的。
一个孩子睡在这里。玩具散落在一张未整理的床上，成堆的衣服掩盖了所有的东西，只有地板上有几块光秃秃的地方。角落里的一张写字台上面悬挂着一个用黄铜和木头做成的龙形木偶，翅膀是用帆布染成的红色。一盏圆形的萤火虫灯挂在对面的角落里。
盖尔比一直在画令人毛骨悚然的图画，描绘了{@i Shemshime's Bedtime Rhyme}的场景。他们用响亮的彩色油漆和典型的儿童风格来完成，使他们更加令人不安。其中一张图片显示一个人的脚被切断了。鲜血从他的脚踝和他旁边的断脚处涌出。另一张图片显示一个男孩在水下，抓着自己的喉咙。最后一幅是一只狗，嘴里叼着一只被砍断的手。一片黑云在每个场景上盘旋。

entries.name: F10. Ebder's Room

entries: 这间稀疏的卧室很整洁，除了一个大树干上放着一个装有特别多醋的残羹剩饭的土碗。
除了装着一套阿沃德长袍和一件厚厚的羊毛大衣的箱子外，房间里还有一张床、一张带着摇晃的椅子的小圆桌，以及挂在洗脸盆上方的一面镜子。地板上铺着一块带灰色流苏的圆形绿色编织地毯。
任何人在床下都会发现一个用银丝装饰的华丽的圆形盒子。盒子里有一个固定在木架上的小玻璃女人雕像和一个用来装戒指的柱子，不过戒指不见了。这些物品是埃布尔对他已故妻子瓦莱什蒂的纪念品。

entries.name: F11. Crinkle's Room
entries: 克林克有这个上锁房间的钥匙。一个角色可以用一个行动来尝试用盗贼的工具来撬锁，如果成功地进行DC20的灵巧检查，就可以做到这一点，或者成功地进行DC20的力量（（%0%））检查来强行打开门。
这个房间里爬满了没有翅膀的幼虫萤火虫。数以百计的这些小萤火虫依附在每一个表面上，在整个房间里散发着光芒。一张帆布吊床挂在房间中心附近的两根柱子之间。一幅戴着王冠的山羊的雕刻靠在北墙。
当人物在{@area event 6|1c0|x}之后第一次进入房间时，添加以下内容。
靠着远处的墙，是辛克尔的颓废的身影。房间里的寂静不时地被她粗重的呼吸声打断。
靠在北墙的冠状山羊雕刻没有什么了不起的地方。它大约有3英尺高，重达150磅。

entries.name: Hidden Treasure
entries: 任何被动智慧（（%0%））得分在15分以上的人都会注意到北墙与西墙交接处的半圆形缝隙中偶尔会有光芒。或者，成功通过DC15智慧({@skill Perception})检查，就能发现零星的发光现象。任何把手指伸进洞里的人都会感觉到一个拨动的开关。如果他们移动开关，一个5英尺宽的面板就会释放出来，并可以滑向一边，露出一排小的存储空间。在事件5之前，{@creature Shemshime|CM}的睡前童谣可以在这里找到。除此之外，这些空间里还有以下宝物：一枚属于艾伯德妻子的琥珀戒指（25金币），一把华丽的弯刀（25金币），一套四个形状复杂的玻璃瓶（每个5金币），里面什么都没有，一个（%3%），和一个（%4%）。

entries.name: F12. Avowed Quarters

entries: 南墙上一幅美丽的《烛台》画作在拥挤在这个房间里的五张床前若隐若现。在东北角有一个狭窄的架子，上面放着水果蜜饯和腌制蔬菜的罐子。
如果人物在地窖里过夜，这里就成为他们的一个指定房间。否则，这个房间是无人居住的。
这个房间里有一张床、一个洗脸盆和一张写字台。书桌上放着一个小小的发条牡蛎。

entries.name: Treasure
entries: 躺在发条牡蛎旁边的是一把金属钥匙。如果一个角色使用动作给机械牡蛎上发条，牡蛎就会产生舒缓的海洋声音，持续10分钟。这个非魔法装置的价值为50gp。

entries.name: F14. Varnyr's Room

entries: 这间卧室可能是图书馆的另一翼，因为所有的书都挤在墙上的书架上。房间中间有两个五英尺高的烛台，上面闪烁着神奇的火焰--从萤火虫灯的相对昏暗的光线中解脱出来，很受欢迎。
每个烛台都被一个{@i continual light}的咒语点燃，{@creature Varnyr|CM}可以通过说出一个只有她自己知道的命令词来压制它。这里的书是{@creature Varnyr|CM}的个人收藏。
房间里有一个大垫子（每当她进入恍惚状态时，（%0%）就坐在上面休息），一个衣柜，和一个绿色天鹅绒阅读椅。衣柜里有衣服，还有一堆书，书架上放不下。

data.name: The Price of Beauty

items: {@b An Adventure for 5th-level Characters}
{@b Developed & Edited by Scott Fitzgerald Gray}
{@b Written by Mark Hulmes}

entries: 在这次冒险中，主人公们了解了捆绑在一本引导自爱和内在美的技巧书中的独特魔法的秘密，他们打破了女巫团的邪恶阴谋。
尽管它的内容很普通，但{@i The Price of Beauty}却因为封面上的一面魔镜而散发着幻觉和魔法的光环。虽然 "神赐者 "从未确定这面镜子的全部功能，但人们知道这本书能与一些阅读者交谈--包括一位从烛台镇消失得无影无踪的圣徒。

entries.name: Beginning the Adventure
entries: 开始冒险时，让人物寻找（%0%），或者让他们在烛台镇进行其他研究时简单地遇到这本书。来到图书馆寻找与苏妮（爱与美之神）有关的信息的角色会被推荐给他们这本巨著。或者你可以让一个虚荣的、富有的贵族雇人追踪这本书，让装订者之家的抄写员复制它的建议。
取决于你是如何将这本书带给人物的，他们可能会花足够的时间与它相处，从而自己发现镜子的魔力。在这种情况下，详情请见冒险后面的"（%0%）"部分。无论怎样，当你准备开始时，请阅读或转述以下内容。
一个 "阿维德 "的人在靠近你之前紧张地嘀咕着，当他们靠近你时，他扫描了周围书架上的书籍。"她一定来过这里......我不明白...... "他们一边喃喃自语，一边说。我不明白...... "他们在看到你时喃喃自语。
"啊，请原谅我的打扰，"圣徒说。"但我在寻找......" 当他们看到{@i The Price of Beauty}时，他们停了下来。"是的，我在找那个。" 然后，看了看你们这群人，圣徒显得很忧伤。"但你没有看到其他人......嗯，你没有看到法尔赛克斯，是吗？"
这个{@creature acolyte}是Lorris Niss，一个寻找失踪朋友的中年、中立的好半精灵。Falthrax Loderr是一个盾牌矮人圣职者，Lorris最后一次见到他是在两天前。洛里斯显然很不高兴，但她在分享以下信息时保持了镇定。

items: 法尔赛是一位亲爱的朋友，他最近被抑郁症所困扰；他谈到感觉好像他的生命正在流逝。
这个矮人的心情在上个星期有所好转，因为他在烛光镇的书堆里发现了一本书--{@i The Price of Beauty}。法尔兹拉克斯已经是美神苏妮的崇拜者，他谈到了这本书是如何与他对话的，以及书中关于冥想和自我价值的建议是如何帮助他。
洛里斯最后一次见到法尔兹拉克斯时，这个矮人心情很悲伤，说他要去花时间看书。法尔萨克斯当晚没有回到他的住处，此后再也没有人看到他。有人注意到他进入了存放{@i The Price of Beauty}的书堆，但没有人看到他离开。

entries.name: Book Description
entries: {@i The Price of Beauty}用柔软的绿色皮革装订，宽八英寸，高十四英寸，并镶有金色的扣子。这本书散发着无可置疑的百合花香味。书的封面上镶嵌着一面抛光的椭圆形镜子，其精致的金框造型就像一绺一绺的头发，看起来就像洒落在任何一个看向镜子的人的脸上。
这本书充满了美丽的林地场景、艺术和珠宝的插图。精致的笔迹伴随着插图，其形式是专门用于寻求自我价值的简短祈祷和冥想，按摩和治疗的技术，以及制作香膏和化妆品的配方。
在最后一页是作者西尔瓦利-西尔弗松的题词，内容如下。"镜子是通往幸福、真理和接受自己的大门"。

entries.name: Mirror Magic
entries: 当任何生物持有{@i The Price of Beauty}并注视着镜子时，苏妮的影像会取代他们自己的倒影，并以柔和的声音说话，说："你好啊，最亲爱的人。你今天感觉如何？"（如果人物还没有经历过这种情况，洛里斯在叙述发生在法尔兹拉克斯身上的事情时看着镜子，然后在镜子对她说话时吓得把书丢了。）
这面镜子独特的幻觉魔法会对看着它的生物做出反应和回应。虽然它没有知觉，也不能回答复杂的问题，但这面镜子提供了关于修饰和自信的鼓励和建议。当它这样做的时候，幻象显示生物在看着镜子，但根据需要改变和修饰它的皮肤、头发、化妆和衣服。如果拿着书的生物对自己的样子很满意，或者对这些事情不感兴趣，幻象就会恢复成普通的镜子，直到再次使用。

如果拿着书的生物提到想要改变自己的某些东西，或者感觉不舒服、疲倦或不快乐，幻象会回应说："如果休息、放松或转变是你需要的，那么就跟着百合花走吧，最亲爱的。我相信希尔瓦里会满足你的需要。" 然后镜子发出柔和的光芒，一个5英尺宽、7英尺高的门户出现在最近的无人空间。这个传送门通向一条古老的林间小道，上面有类似于石雕百合花的柱子作为标记。正如角色们将发现的那样，这个传送门通向一个由三个精灵姐妹经营的寺庙和澡堂，在那里，一切都不像看上去那样。
传送门在5分钟内保持活跃，然后消失。{@i The Price of Beauty}在下一个黎明前不能用于创建另一个传送门。
如果传送门在洛里斯在场时显现，圣徒就会正确地猜测它是法尔赛克斯失踪的原因。她害怕所涉及的强大魔法，对她的朋友可能发生的事情感到忧虑。
如果角色们不愿意调查传送门或去找失踪的圣徒，Lorris就去找图书馆的一个大阅读者报告Falthrax的失踪，她提到在图书馆里遇到了一群冒险家。然后，大阅读者召集了这些人物，恳请他们调查此事。

entries.name: Temple of the Restful Lily
entries: 这座宏伟的寺庙和澡堂坐落在银月城东南的高级森林里，是一片宁静而古老的小树林。这座寺庙是一个多世纪前由{@i The Price of Beauty}的作者希尔瓦里-西尔弗松(Sylvarie Silversong)建造的，因为苏妮赐予她的幻觉将她带到了一个充满了费伊族魔法的温泉。
十年前，一个自称是 "恋恋不舍"（Fetid Gaze）的绿衣女巫团欺骗了希尔瓦里，使他们得以接管澡堂。这些残忍而狡猾的妖怪现在利用神庙来引诱富有、贪婪、虚荣的贵族和冒险家，利用他们的不安全感，诱使他们接受最终导致痛苦的黑暗交易。
这座寺庙由三座建筑组成。曾经是希尔瓦里的私人塔楼已经被女巫们占为巢穴，而以前苏妮的神龛已经成为被诅咒的精灵的监狱。主澡堂看起来和希尔瓦里建造的一模一样，而且它继续为游客提供服务。浴场的大部分工作人员都是女巫会伪装的邪恶爪牙，但这里也有一个卧底的哈珀特工、一个水鬼和一个被诅咒的科波德--他们都是可以揭穿女巫会的恶意阴谋的潜在盟友。

entries.name: The Fetid Gaze
entries: 三个{@creature Green Hag||green hags}名叫可怕的摩根、卑鄙的萨莎和绿骨阿姨的人曾经是对手，他们居住在与高等森林相邻的精灵世界的一个地区。十年前，在各个星球之间的边界变薄的时候，女巫们意识到了希尔瓦里控制的魔法泉，并决定为自己的目的控制和腐蚀它。觊觎的女巫们每个人都知道制作魔法画的部分仪式，可以用可怕的诅咒束缚凡人的生物。在同意分享他们的知识并一起工作后，他们组成了一个女巫团，致力于夺取希尔瓦里的神庙，并将其作为他们邪恶计划的基地。
女巫们利用她们的幻觉能力，冒充三个精灵姐妹，分别是摩根娜、阿兹尔萨和格林松。她们通常白天在澡堂里，晚上在塔楼的巢穴里。每个女巫都有一把万能钥匙，可以打开澡堂和塔楼的所有门。

entries.name: Dread Morgan
entries: 在她的真实形态中，中性恶魔（%0%）表现为一个瘦弱、苍白的生物，她长长的、枯萎的黑发上缀满了骨头和牙齿制成的装饰品。她的嘴角不自然地翘起，血红的嘴唇上长满了水泡和疖子。
在她的伪装下，女巫以摩根娜的身份出现，她是一个修长的月精灵，有着光滑的黑发和闪亮的蓝宝石眼睛。她用沙哑、诱人的声音说话，专注于经营澡堂的业务。
可怕的摩根知道将一个生物的欲望与一幅被诅咒的画捆绑在一起所需的仪式，这个仪式被记录在一个隐藏在她头发上的骨饰中的小卷轴上。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "我已经把微妙的侮辱变成了一种艺术形式。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "任何野蛮人都可以吓唬人。真正让人感到恐惧是一门高超的艺术。"

entries.name: Bond
entries: "为了在我的女巫团的其他成员中占上风，使他们为我服务，我将不惜一切代价。"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "我发现强大的、具有威慑力的人物是不可抗拒的。"

entries.name: Vile Sazha
entries: 在没有伪装的情况下，混沌恶魔（%0%）看起来是一个驼背的形象，有一只肌肉发达的手臂和一只枯萎的手臂。她有一双猫一样的眼睛，锈红色的头发覆盖着她的头部、背部和手臂。她锋利的獠牙使她说话时口齿不清，受到威胁时发出嘶嘶声和尖叫。
在她的伪装下，她以阿兹尔萨的身份出现，她是一个有着铜色头发的运动型太阳精灵，穿着华丽的胸甲和红色的毛皮斗篷。她有着自信和欢快的声音，她提倡体力和健康。
卑鄙的Sazha知道如何为女巫的诅咒画创造一个合适的画布。这个秘密被纹在她枯萎的手臂上，它描述了一个可怕的过程，将精灵的肉体伸展到一个由浸过血的木头制成的框架上。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "我鄙视弱者，当我能逃脱时，我喜欢施加身体上的痛苦和暴力。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "力量是唯一值得尊重的东西"。

entries.name: Bond
entries: "矮人很久以前就烧毁了我的家，杀死了我的女儿，我将永远憎恨他们所有的同类。"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "我很害怕火。"

entries.name: Auntie Greenbones
entries: 她是费蒂德凝视的最年长的成员，合法的邪恶（%0%）在决策上经常听从另外两个女巫的意见。在她的真身中，她干瘪而破旧，深绿色的皮肤上覆盖着树皮和真菌。昆虫在她身上爬来爬去，藏在像蛇一样卷在她肩上的厚厚的白发辫子里。任何人盯着她那双乳白色的、似乎是盲目的眼睛，都会看到自己的脸被岁月折磨得颓废和枯萎的倒影。
女巫的伪装是绿松，一个开朗的、脸色红润的木精灵，假装失明。她的眼睛上戴着精致的白纱，说话时用唱的声音，经常傻笑。她一直带着她的警卫犬莫蒂。这只伪装过的（%0%）看起来是一只眼睛充血的藏獒。
绿骨头阿姨知道如何将恶魔的汁液注入到创作受诅咒的画作所需的颜料中，以推动女巫团的邪恶交易。这个配方被刻在了莫蒂的衣领内侧。

entries.name: Personality Trait
entries: "有时我在心烦意乱时，会对自己唱歌。这是一首费伊族的老歌，讲的是一个女儿被她父亲背叛，在交易中被送给了非精灵。"

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "耐心是生存的关键。谁笑到最后，谁就笑得最久"。

entries.name: Bond
entries: "我心爱的狗，莫蒂，是我的世界。如果有人伤害他，如果有必要，我会在所有的星球上追捕那个人。"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "那些拥有纯洁心灵的人简直让我呕吐。我的意思是，在他们面前，我忍不住要呕吐。"

entries.name: Coven Spells
entries: {@creature Hag of the Fetid Gaze|CM|the Fetid Gaze}的每个成员都可以使用女巫团的法术，如{@book Monster Manual|MM}中的 "女巫团 "侧边栏所述。绿衣女巫使用以下的法术清单作为他们的共享法术特质，取代了建议的法术。
1级（4个插槽）。{@spell charm person}, {@spell witch bolt}
第二层（3个槽）。{@spell alter self}, {@spell suggestion}
第三级（3个插槽）。{@spell dispel magic}, {@spell glyph of warding}, {@spell slow}
第四级（3个插槽）。{@spell blight}, {@spell polymorph}
第五级（2个槽）。{@spell dominate person}, {@spell seeming}
6级（1个插槽）。{@spell Otto's irresistible dance}

entries.name: Coven Minions
entries: 媚惑之眼的女巫们雇佣了一些爪牙来维持澡堂正常运行的外观。每天两次，女巫们用她们的巫师团法术（见 "巫师团法术 "边栏）对她们的爪牙施展（%0%），根据她们的角色进行适当的伪装。
下列生物为女巫服务。

items: 萨伊特，一个（%0%），被可怕的摩根招募，以换取一份不寻常的组件和秘密仪式的礼物，他打算有一天将其用于自己邪恶而雄心勃勃的计划。萨特特别想了解被诅咒的绘画的秘密，他很乐意背叛他的雇主以获得这些秘密。他带着一把万能钥匙，可以打开澡堂和塔楼的所有锁，除了通往塔楼工作室的门（{@area area T15|23f|x}）。他还带着女巫团的{@i hag eye}，伪装成他外套上的猫眼针。关于{@i hag eye}的更多信息，请参见{@book Monster Manual|MM}中的 "女巫 "部分。
莫蒂，一个{@creature hell hound}，属于绿骨头阿姨，是她忠实的宠物。这个恶魔从未离开过她的身边，并为保护她而战斗至死。卑鄙的萨兹哈对莫蒂的憎恨几乎和她对矮人的憎恨一样多，并且很想看到他死。
六个（%0%）是女巫们创造的，用来取代苏妮的信徒，苏妮和希尔瓦莉一起经营澡堂，女巫们在接管时将其杀害。稻草人被伪装成有吸引力的人形生物。他们在担任澡堂工作人员时不说话，但如果有人跟他们说话，他们会点头微笑。
两个（%0%）充当女巫团在澡堂外的塔里的巢穴的守护者，伪装成其他种类的雕像。

entries.name: Roleplaying the Hags
entries: 女巫们把希尔瓦里的塔作为她们的个人巢穴，但她们整天都在澡堂里，保持她们的伪装。在那里，她们与游客见面，并寻找潜在的新客户来操纵。到了晚上，她们退到塔里，在休息之前折磨她们目前的受害者。
如果任何客人对女巫或其爪牙产生怀疑，女巫就会试图用{@spell suggestion}或{@spell dominate person}来隔离这些人物，这样他们就可以被捕获或谨慎地杀掉。

一旦女巫们意识到冒险家们不在寺庙里做礼拜，她们就试图分散他们的注意力，恳求角色们提供援助，以换取她们的一种特殊仪式。巫师们首先试图招募人物去摧毁被绑在浴池里的{@creature naiad|CM}赛琳娜，声称一个 "任性的元素之灵 "一直在攻击客人，并试图将澡堂作为它的家。如果这些角色看起来特别有能力或危险，女巫们也可能试图欺骗他们，让他们在废弃的神殿下面的圣池里毁掉希尔瓦里（{@area area T12|234|x}），希望这个被诅咒的精灵变成的美杜莎在这个过程中石化他们中的一个或多个。
巫师团最大的弱点是巫婆们相互之间的蔑视。每个人都渴望了解其他人创造诅咒之画的秘密，以便有一天她们可以用自己的女儿取代对手。因此，了解这些秘密的人物可以获得对女巫们的相当大的影响力。

entries.name: Dark Bargains and Cursed Paintings
entries: 创作诅咒画的过程，是Fetid Gaze的标志，最早归功于一位夜巫婆的祖母，其他巫婆不敢说出她的名字。这个方法仍然被掩盖在秘密之中，"迷幻凝视 "的每个成员都只知道这个过程的一个部分。每个女巫都热衷于保护自己的知识，害怕泄露自己的秘密会使她成为其他女巫的牺牲品。
巫婆伪装成精灵，引诱客人接受神奇的转变。他们的仪式，也就是所谓的治疗，表面上看起来是完全有益的（见下面的"{@area Magic Treatments|20a|x}"），而且女巫们擅长欺骗客人，让他们认为好处多于代价。
这些特殊仪式的价格被描述为 "一些小恩惠"，姐妹们承诺在一年内调用。任何接受交易的生物都会被带到神庙塔楼的工作室({@area area T15|23f|x})，在那里姐妹们一起工作，在1小时内为该生物画一幅美丽的肖像。在这段时间结束时，画像的魔力会以理想的方式改变该生物。
该交易授予的好处通常持续一年。之后，受益者会突然经历与仪式预期效果相反的情况，将生物转化为其最初欲望的黑暗反映。例如，那些追求身体力量的人被削弱到无助的地步，而那些追求美貌的人则变得面目可憎。如果一个生物在一年期满之前放弃了女巫的礼物，这个诅咒就会立即生效。
在过去的十年里，女巫们已经诅咒了数百名受害者，其中大多数人都因为她们的黑暗交易而丧生。

entries.name: Magic Treatments
entries: 女巫通常向NPC提供的魔法利益可以采取任何对故事有意义的形式。如果一个或多个角色为女巫的服务达成交易（即使只是为了了解更多的程序），请使用以下准则来确定角色的利益。

items.name: Ability Enhancement
items.entry: 如果从事一项交易以提高身体或精神的敏锐度，角色选择一种能力。该能力的分数会增加2分，就像该人物的最大分数一样。

items.name: Physical Transformation
items.entry: 与女巫谈判的角色可以选择以任何方式改变他们的种族、性别或外观。该角色保留他们的能力分数和等级特征，但如果适用的话，会改变他们的种族特征。

items.name: Youth
items.entry: 一个以年轻为代价的角色，他们的年龄会降低到比成年标准大一岁（如角色的种族特征中所指出的）。

entries: 所有这些好处的持续时间不超过一年，如果女巫创造的角色的画被毁，它们就会立即结束。如果一个角色保持他们的画一年或者放弃交易，你可以决定诅咒带来的效果。被诅咒的角色也会获得以下缺陷，它可以抑制角色已经拥有的任何冲突的人格特质。"我的外表和别人对我的看法对我来说是最重要的。"

entries.name: Destroying the Paintings
entries: 即使女巫被杀，画作的魔力依然存在，而摧毁一幅画是结束其诅咒的唯一方法。任何研究过创造诅咒之画的所有三部分程序的生物都知道，除非它的魔力能被瞬间破坏，否则画是不受伤害的。在不完全了解程序的情况下，需要花1小时研究一幅画，并成功通过DC18智力（（%0%））检查来确定这一事实。
一个生物可以使用一个行动来试图摧毁一幅画，只要成功地进行DC18力量（（%0%））检查就可以了。如果检查失败，该生物会受到14({@dice 4d6})的精神伤害。任何使用行动来检查这幅画的角色都知道，只要成功地进行DC18智力（（%2%））检查，这幅画也可以通过用天人的鲜血泼洒来摧毁。
放在每个被诅咒的生物身上的蛊惑可以防止它试图破坏一幅被诅咒的画。

entries.name: Coven Victims
entries: 除了失踪的法尔兹拉克斯之外，还有其他几位被女巫诅咒的受害者目前也在神庙里。

{@b Sylvarie Silversong} (a neutral good moon elf) founded the Temple of the Restful Lily after being drawn to the hot spring by the visions of Sune. Her deep-seated insecurity over serving the god of beauty was her downfall. Hoping to develop more confidence in her role as a priest of Sune, she was drawn into a bargain with the hags that saw her transformed into a {@creature medusa} and trapped in the temple's former shrine for ten years. See {@area area T12|234|x} for more information.

{@b Gorba Daardenrian} (a lawful neutral dragonborn of gold dragon ancestry) was a mighty warrior who sought even greater strength through her bargain with the hags. When she realized the true nature of the bargain shortly before the curse struck, the dragonborn returned to the temple to challenge the coven, but she became a withered husk of her former self as she arrived (use the {@creature commoner} stat block for her current state). Now trapped here, she is especially fearful of Vile Sazha, who torments her relentlessly.

{@b Glitter} (a chaotic good male tiefling) is a member of the Waterdeep Jewelers Guild, as well as an informant for one of the Masked Lords of the city. He came to the temple wanting to be a few inches taller, thinking the extra height would prove advantageous when conducting business transactions, but he renounced the hags' bargain when his new, taller form didn't suit him. The hags' curse transformed him into a kobold (though he uses the {@creature spy} stat block). In his new form, Glitter now bitterly serves the hags, speaking eloquently and addressing guests kindly. If the characters agree to help him undo the hags' curse, Glitter assures them they will gain a powerful ally in Waterdeep, as well as receive 500 gp in gems as soon as he can return to the city.

{@b Falthrax Loderr} (a neutral good shield dwarf {@creature commoner}) became fearful of growing old after a lifetime of dedication to Candlekeep. After coming through the portal and being drawn in by the splendor and magic of the bathhouse, he bargained with the hags to restore his youth. But when second thoughts caused him to renounce the bargain, the hags' curse aged him well into his venerable years, and he is now wracked with constant pain. Having no idea how to return to Candlekeep and his old life, he has accepted his fate with quiet resignation, and he weeps quietly to himself when anyone speaks to him.

entries.name: Guests of the Temple
entries: The Temple of the Restful Lily is known among the more elite folk of the Sword Coast, and any number of those folk might be visiting when the characters arrive. You can roll for or choose entries from the Temple Guests table, or use those guests as inspiration for your own NPCs.

entries.caption: Temple Guests
rows: A {@creature drow} poses as Jarlaxle Baenre, the leader of a famous mercenary band called Bregan D'aerthe, in the hope of obtaining discounted treatments. The impostor's disguise is easily detected by anyone who has met the real Jarlaxle.

A {@creature veteran} of the Flaming Fist, a ruthless mercenary company based in the city of Baldur's Gate, has come to the temple to recover from a leg injury. The treatments and physical therapy are helping, but the mercenary is bored and looking for excitement.

A pair of halfling {@creature Scout||scouts} from the coastal city of Neverwinter used the profits from a recent shady job to treat themselves to a luxurious stay at the temple, but they are paranoid about other guests recognizing them.

A merchant and her wife (both {@creature Commoner||commoners}) have come to the bathhouse to celebrate their anniversary, but it is clear that the two are having relationship issues. One of them wants to go home, while the other does not.
A young {@creature knight} who belongs to an order called the Purple Dragons has traveled all the way to the temple from Cormyr, seeking Sune's advice on how best to impress their betrothed.

A dwarf {@creature noble} from Citadel Adbar, a dwarven city-stronghold far to the north, recently suffered a magical malady causing them to lose all their hair. Wearing a wig and fake beard, they have come to the temple hoping to find a cure for the condition before the truth is found out.
A rock gnome inventor (use the {@creature noble} stat block) from the city of Silverymoon has come to the bathhouse to sell the owners a collection of cleaning gadgets.

A lawful neutral {@creature assassin} targeting evil nobles has come to the bathhouse to hide out from the authorities, after recently botching an assignment in Waterdeep or some other city of your choice.

entries.name: Arriving at the Temple
entries: The Temple of the Restful Lily is built around a fey-enchanted hot spring in a large open grove in the High Forest. The woodland trail accessed through the portal created by {@i The Price of Beauty} leads to the temple from the east after a journey of a quarter mile. A longer trail leads west from the temple, winds northward, and ends at the edge of the forest south of Silverymoon. Both trails converge on the south side of the bathhouse building and the double doors leading into {@area area T1|212|x}.

If the characters put off entering the bathhouse building to first wander the grounds, the {@creature cambion} Saeth (see "{@area Coven Minions|207|x}" earlier in the adventure) leaves {@area area T1|212|x} to intercept them. He encourages the characters to return with him to the bathhouse, describing the abandoned shrine as a dangerous place to be avoided, and saying that the tower is a private residence that cannot be entered. He does not force the issue, however.

Saeth calls for reinforcements if he is attacked or if anyone tries to forcibly enter the abandoned shrine or the tower. If the characters are intent on starting this part of the adventure with combat, you might lead off with a challenging fight against the hags and all their servants, then have the characters put the pieces of the mystery together in the aftermath.

entries.name: Temple Features
entries: The following features are common to all areas of the bathhouse, the tower, and the shrine unless otherwise noted.

entries.name: Relaxing at the Restful Lily
entries: The Temple of the Restful Lily offers many services and treatments that characters in search of rest and respite can make use of. This feature of the place can allow the characters to socialize with the NPCs in residence—or can provide opportunities for the coven's minions to attack them while their guard is down. Health services at the temple include the following:

items: Entry to the bathhouse costs 5 gp per person and includes the use of the enchanted baths, a comfortable robe, and a private changing room with a lockable trunk to store weapons and equipment.
Lodging for visitors who want to stay overnight at the temple is available at a cost of 4 gp per person. Meals cost 5 sp, and the lounge offers a wide range of beverages.
Characters can enjoy a haircut, a shave, or a waxing for 2 gp, 1 gp, or 10 gp, respectively.
Massages can be booked for 20 gp and last for an hour.
A manicure and pedicure costs 2 sp. The pedicure might incur an additional fee depending on the cleanliness of the customer's feet.

items.name: Walls and Floors
items.entry: The bathhouse and the tower are luxuriously appointed, with walls and floors of polished stone. The stonework in the abandoned shrine is crumbling and caked with grime.

items.name: Doors
items.entry: Inside the bathhouse and the tower, wooden doors are carved with images of water lilies. Doors in the bathhouse are normally unlocked, but they can be locked by anyone who has a master key. Doors in the tower are normally locked. Unless otherwise noted, a locked door can be opened with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check using thieves' tools, broken in with a successful DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, or attacked. A door has AC 15, 18 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

items.name: Windows
items.entry: Within the bathhouse and the tower, finely made windows display abstract designs in stained glass. A window can be broken through with a successful DC 12 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or attacked; each one has AC 13, 3 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

items.name: Light
items.entry: All areas of the bathhouse and the tower are filled with bright light during the day and evening, either from sunlight or lanterns. After midnight, these areas are dark unless characters are using a light source. The ground floor of the shrine ({@area area T11|230|x}) is unlit, while its basement is lit by a magic pool (see {@area area T12|234|x} for details).

entries.name: Temple Locations T1-T9
entries: The following locations are keyed to the maps of the Temple of the Restful Lily.

images.title: Map 7.1: Temple of the Restful Lily

entries.name: T1. Lobby

entries: The double doors open to the sound of a bell. Beyond the doors is a large lobby, the air heavy with the scent of fresh lilies. A desk stands at the center of the room, holding neatly piled papers and fresh-cut lilies in a vase. A dark-haired man in fine clothes stands up from behind the desk as he sees you.

"Welcome, friends, to the Restful Lily. Freshen yourselves in our luxurious bathhouse. Or perhaps you'd enjoy a massage? Haircut? A shave or pedicure? Oh! Road-tired feet simply cry out for comfort! Whatever your pleasure, I am here to serve."

The lobby is staffed by the disguised {@creature cambion} Saeth (see "{@area Coven Minions|207|x}" earlier in the adventure). He greets the characters warmly and is happy to explain the treatments and services on offer (as noted in the "{@area Relaxing at the Restful Lily|210|x}" sidebar). If the characters ask about the missing Falthrax, Saeth feigns ignorance. If the characters aren't interested in the Restful Lily's services at present, he encourages them to look around. In any event, as soon as he is able to do so, he leaves the characters to their own devices and slips away to inform one of the hags about the party's arrival before returning to his desk. The characters are free to explore the temple on their own at this point.

entries.name: T2. Changing Rooms

entries: A corridor beyond the lobby runs between two rows of curtained cubicles, where guests can change out of traveling clothes and armor. Each cubicle contains a wooden stool, two white robes hanging on hooks, and a large wooden trunk with a lock.

If the characters pay to enter the baths or want to enjoy any of the other facilities, they are asked to change and store their weapons and equipment here. One robe of each pair is sized for Medium characters, while the other fits Small characters. Saeth gives a character a numbered key that corresponds to that character's cubicle and trunk. He carries a master key that opens all the trunks. As an action, a character can try to pick the lock on a trunk using thieves' tools, doing so with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check, or force open a trunk with a successful DC 12 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

entries.name: T3. Lounge

entries: Large cushioned chairs are set around this open space. Calming music fills the air, which carries a floral scent. A bar takes up one corner of the room, alongside shelves of expensive wines and spirits and baskets of fresh fruit. Two tables stand along one wall, each set up as a manicure and pedicure station with nail files, clippers, and bottles of nail varnish.

The lounge is watched over by two members of the staff, who serve drinks to the guests and perform other mundane tasks asked of them. Both are disguised {@creature Scarecrow||scarecrows} (see "{@area Coven Minions|207|x}" earlier in the adventure). The music is a permanent auditory illusion.

During the day, the hag Dread Morgan is often here in the guise of the moon elf Morganna, talking to other guests and trying to convince likely prospects to indulge in the temple's "special treatments." She takes notice of the characters and welcomes them, playing the part of a gracious host while she tries to learn as much about them as possible.

entries.name: T4. Garden

entries: An iron fence overgrown with ivy surrounds this small garden. An earthen path weaves between a scattering of trees, flower bushes, and stone benches. Various iron weights, wooden poles, and heavy sacks are strewn about the place.

In the guise of Azirssa, one of the elf sisters, Vile Sazha uses the garden as a place to exercise and torment guests with physical training. One of the trees in the garden is an {@creature awakened tree} under her control, which she uses in her workouts and which defends her if she is attacked.
When the characters arrive, a few other guests of the temple might be here, looking exhausted and clutching aching limbs while the disguised hag sarcastically congratulates them on doing their best.

entries.name: Azirssa's Workouts
entries: Any character who wants to can join in one of the {@creature Green Hag||hag's} workouts. If any characters look particularly unfit or scrawny, Vile Sazha singles them out and tries to goad them into joining in, offering them a magic potion if they can complete three activities. A character can give up, ending a workout activity at any time. The three activities are as follows:

items.name: Squats
items.entry: To complete this activity, a character must perform three sets of continuous squats and succeed on three incrementally harder Constitution checks—DC 10, DC 13, and DC 16, respectively. A character who fails a check has disadvantage on the next Constitution check they make as part of this activity. A character who fails three checks in a row must finish a short or long rest before attempting this activity again.

entries.name: Tug-of-War
entries: To complete this activity, a character must stay on their feet in a tug-of-war against the awakened tree. Have the character make DC 16 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks until a check either fails by 5 or more or succeeds. In the former case, the character falls {@condition prone} and takes 3 ({@dice 1d6}) bludgeoning damage from being pulled to the ground by the tree. In the latter case, the character wins the tug-of-war. In either case, the contest ends.

items.name: Chain Skipping
items.entry: To complete this activity, a character must succeed on three DC 13 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks, representing their attempt to stay on their feet while they try to jump over a heavy metal chain being spun by Vile Sazha and the awakened tree. If a check fails, the character is knocked off balance, and the DC for the next check becomes 15. If a check fails by 5 or more, the character is also struck by the chain and takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: If a character completes all three workout activities, Azirssa begrudgingly gives them a {@item Potion of Hill Giant Strength||potion of giant strength (hill)} as a reward. If more than one character completes all three activities, Vile Sazha gives the potion to the character who had the fewest failed checks or the one she likes best (a purely subjective choice on her part).

entries.name: T5. Bath and Hot Spring

entries: A floor of polished white marble surrounds a large central pool of steaming turquoise water in this large, open-air bath. Stone pillars stand along the outside wall, sculpted with relief carvings of Sune. Between the pillars, frosted windows diffuse the light from outside through the mist that hangs in the air.
This bathhouse is built around a natural hot spring. The pool is 10 feet deep, and its magically infused waters grant several benefits. Water removed from the pool loses its magic in 10 minutes.

entries.name: Hot Spring
entries: A creature that spends at least 1 hour in the bath gains the benefit of a {@spell greater restoration} spell (the creature decides which of the spell's effects is bestowed on it). A creature can benefit from this property of the pool only once per month. Beyond the effect of the spell, the water causes a creature's skin to appear healthier and younger, tones down the appearance of scars and burns, and helps to regrow lost hair.

A fey creature called a {@creature naiad|MOT} (see the accompanying stat block) is bound to this spring in the same way that a dryad maintains a connection to a tree. The {@creature naiad|CM}, Cyrena, came to an understanding with Sylvarie when the elf founded the temple: the {@creature naiad|CM} was allowed access to the pool and its magic in exchange for swearing to protect the waters.

Cyrena can cause the water to harm creatures of her choice as though it were an equivalent volume of acid. Currently, she has made the water harmful to the hags and their minions, and she can make it harmful to characters who offend or threaten her. Any such creature that enters the pool or starts its turn immersed in it takes 11 ({@dice 2d10}) acid damage.

Cyrena knows the hags and their minions for what they truly are. Because the water of the pool is harmful to them, they have been forced to leave the {@creature naiad|CM} alone, even as they plot to destroy her.

Cyrena doesn't know what happened to Sylvarie, but even after ten years, she is sad about her friend's disappearance. Her nervousness around other creatures has prevented the {@creature naiad|CM} from asking directly for aid. She perceives dangerous-looking creatures as servants of the hags. If she believes a character to be pure of heart or an ally of nature, she begs them to help her discover what happened to Sylvarie.

entries.name: T6. Kitchen

entries: This kitchen has long counters and numerous shelves full of pots, pans, and utensils. Metal racks stuffed with herbs, flowers, fruits, and vegetables hang from the ceiling.

By day, Auntie Greenbones is usually here, in disguise as the blind wood elf Greensong with her faithful hound Morty at her side. She prepares delicious-looking but tainted meals for guests of the temple, often slipping in putrid ingredients or traces of poison. Any guest who suffers the effect of a tainted meal is told that they are feeling toxins and impurities leaving their body as a result of the healthy living the temple promotes.

The hag keeps her awful ingredients hidden in a secret compartment in the kitchen cupboards, which can be found with a successful DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check (see "Treasure" below). If her stash is discovered, Greensong feigns innocence and says, untruthfully, that the drow aesthetician Ilmar (see area T7) was seen poking around in the kitchen a few days ago.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Auntie Greenbones's stash includes beholder tears, ground unicorn hoof, chimera vomit, and other foul reagents of your choice. These ingredients are worth a total of 100 gp to an alchemist or a poisoner. The stash also includes a stoppered and labeled glass vial containing three doses of {@item assassin's blood} (see "{@book Poisons|DMG|8|Poisons}" in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).

entries.name: T7. Treatment Rooms

entries: These adjoining chambers, dimly lit with shrouded lamps, are each furnished with a bed whose frame can be tilted and folded into different positions. Shelves and counters hold an array of perfumes, oils, and lotions, and scented candles that fill the room with a pleasantly invigorating scent.

Guests who request haircuts, shaving, waxing, or massages are tended to in these treatment rooms. Ilmar Mizzrym (a chaotic good {@creature drow}) works here as the head aesthetician of the bathhouse. He wears a simple belted silk robe and flat shoes, and speaks in a soft, hushed voice. Without armor, his AC is 12.

Ilmar is secretly a Harper agent and worshiper of Eilistraee who goes by the code name Dusk. He was a close friend of Sylvarie's years ago, but fell out of touch with her before the temple was built. If the characters get on Ilmar's good side with roleplaying or a successful DC 17 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, he confides his true identity to them and shares his story.

entries.name: Ilmar's Search
entries: Three months ago, Ilmar received a haunting vision of his old friend Sylvarie, who appeared to be in a suffering state, and appearing as though her face was being reflected in a broken mirror. Looking into his former friend's activities since they parted ways led him to Silverymoon a month ago, then to the temple. Ilmar instinctively suspected that the goings-on at the bathhouse hid some dark secret and decided to investigate by posing as an aesthetician seeking employment.

Ilmar has seen through the illusions covering the hags and their minions, and he shares that knowledge if he trusts the characters. He suspects that information about Sylvarie's fate can be found in the shrine or the tower, but has so far been unable to investigate those areas because the coven's minions keep a close eye on him. (The two disguised {@creature Scarecrow||scarecrows} from area T9 lurk around the guest rooms at night, and the {@creature gargoyle} above the tower entrance of {@area area T13|23a|x} watches the grounds north of the bathhouse for any sign of Ilmar skulking around.)

If the characters agree to help discover what happened to Sylvarie, Ilmar offers to join them, or to help by creating a distraction in the bathhouse that might give the characters a chance to slip into the tower or the shrine unnoticed.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Ilmar keeps a silvered {@item shortsword|PHB}, a {@item hand crossbow|PHB} with twenty {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|bolts}, and a {@item spell scroll} of {@spell greater restoration} hidden underneath the massage bed in the south treatment room. These can be discovered by any character who searches the room. He keeps a vial of {@item oil of slipperiness} hidden among the massage lotions and oils on the shelf in the north treatment room. It can be spotted with a successful DC 14 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

entries.name: T8. Storage
entries: A silk-curtained doorway leads into a storage room piled high with crates and items on shelves. Stock and supplies for the bathhouse are kept here, including towels, robes, bed linens, bottles, and stores of grain, fruits, nuts, and salted meat.

When the characters first enter this area, one {@creature scarecrow} disguised as a humanoid staff member (see "{@area Coven Minions|207|x}" earlier in the adventure) is present, sorting supplies and arranging boxes.

entries.name: T9. Guest Rooms
entries: All the rooms in this area have the same basic features, plus additional contents related to their occupants. You can decide how many rooms are occupied based on how many NPCs are presently at the temple (see "{@area Guests of the Temple|20d|x}" earlier in the adventure).
This well-furnished guest room contains a comfortable bed, a sturdy chest for storage, a wall lantern, a full-length mirror, and a desk that holds small bottles of lotions and soaps.

Each guest of the temple is given a key that locks both the door and the chest, either of which can also be opened with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check using thieves' tools or forced open with a successful DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. The hags and Saeth each carry a master key.

During the day, two disguised {@creature Scarecrow||scarecrows} (see "{@area Coven Minions|207|x}" earlier in the adventure) clean any unoccupied rooms. If the characters are staying here, the hags might instruct the scarecrows to "misplace" (steal) any potions, weapons, or other valuable items left in the characters' rooms.

entries.name: Working Late
entries: If the characters take rooms and spend one or more nights at the temple, the character who has the highest passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score is awakened at a time of your choice by a quiet disturbance:
A kobold with white scales and purple eyes is fiddling with the lock on one of the guest room doors. He wears a patchwork dress and is quietly cursing and whispering.

Glitter, a tiefling {@creature spy} transformed into a kobold by the hags (see "{@area Coven Victims|20c|x}" earlier in the adventure), is working late for his masters. He is trying to fix a broken lock, though the characters might assume he is trying to break into the room by picking the lock. He has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet and doesn't need light to do his work.

Glitter immediately surrenders if confronted and tries to explain himself. If any character treats him kindly or seems to be heroic, he might tell the characters the truth of his transformation and beg their help to undo the curse. Glitter knows what happened to Sylvarie, as well as the layout of the bathhouse and the tower. He also knows that the hags store a selection of their cursed paintings in the servants' quarters in the tower ({@area area T17|245|x}).

entries.name: T10. Ilmar's Room

entries: The cluttered state of this room suggests that its occupant has been staying at the temple for some time. Clothes and cosmetic products are scattered across the floor and the desk.
This room is the quarters of Ilmar Mizzrym (see {@area area T7|223|x}). A character who searches the room discovers a sack hidden in the mattress.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The sack holds three diamonds (50 gp each) and a silver {@item holy symbol|PHB} of Eilistraee (25 gp), the drow god of beauty, dance, and the hunt. A {@item chain shirt|PHB} and a {@item rapier|PHB} are stored inside the room's locked chest.

entries.name: T11. Abandoned Shrine
entries: This former shrine to Sune has fallen into disrepair over a decade of neglect. It is partially hidden behind the baths and obscured by overgrown trees and scrub. If the characters haven't already scouted the grounds, any character in the baths ({@area area T5|21d|x}) who has a passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score of 13 or higher spots the ruined stone building behind the trees. Characters who travel from the bathhouse to the tower can easily see the shrine.

This crumbling stone building must once have been a beautiful shrine. Engraved images of Sune are still visible on the moss-covered stones, her face gazing down on the path by which the faithful would have approached. Stone doors at the front of the shrine appear to be sealed shut by some sort of thick, clear resin. A faint inscription is still visible above them:
"Welcome, dearest ones. Come find the beauty within you."

During the day, the shrine is quiet. At night, any character moving around the shrine who has a passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score of 14 or higher hears what sounds like sobbing or muttering coming from within.

The door is sealed firmly, as are the shrine's four windows, and all are coated by an unnaturally resilient resin of the hags' creation. A character can open a door or window as an action, but only by forcing it with a successful DC 20 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. Any of the hags can touch an area of resin as an action, causing it to turn into slime that flows away over 1 minute.

A hole in the roof 30 feet above the statue of Sune (see below) offers another way in, and is just big enough for a Medium creature to squeeze through. One of the hags comes here at night every few days to throw down firewood and scraps of food for Sylvarie.

entries.name: Inside the Shrine
entries: When the characters get a good look inside the shrine, read the following:

The interior of the shrine has the appearance of having been abandoned after some sort of terrible confrontation years ago. Broken benches with shredded cushions are overgrown by thick fungi, and four large mirrors hanging on the walls have been shattered, leaving the stone floor covered in shards of broken glass.

A grime-encrusted statue of Sune stands against the far wall. The statue's expression might once have suggested smiling laughter, but streaks of dirt now make it appear as though she is weeping. Behind the statue, a staircase descends into darkness.

The broken glass covering the floor imposes disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to move through the area. If any creature without footwear or other protection moves across the broken glass, treat the area as covered in {@item Caltrops (bag of 20)|PHB|caltrops} (see "{@book Adventuring Gear|PHB|5|Adventuring Gear}" in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}).

entries.name: T12. Sacred Pool
entries: The stairs behind the statue in the shrine lead down to a dimly lit chamber.

A soft white glow rises from a square pool set into the floor of this chamber. Torn cushions, rugs, tapestries, and clothing have been piled in one corner as a makeshift bed, while twigs and scraps of deadfall form a simple campfire nearby.

Sylvarie has been transformed into a {@creature medusa} and spends most of her time in this chamber. The glowing light is produced by an object at the bottom of the pool (see "Treasure" below). The pool is also home to a {@creature water weird} that has been Sylvarie's only companion for the ten years of her incarceration. The water weird fights alongside her if it perceives that she is threatened.

entries.name: Sylvarie's Curse
entries: Sylvarie Silversong was a devoted priest of Sune who shared her knowledge and uplifted others to help them realize their own worth. Sadly, her devotion to others masked the moon elf's own self-doubt, which made her feel that she wasn't worthy enough to be a priest of the god of love and beauty.

The hags used her insecurity to manipulate and corrupt Sylvarie ten years ago. Concealing their true nature, they enticed the priest into a dark bargain—and a terrible curse. After a year, the painting created of Sylvarie that had boosted her esteem transformed her into a medusa. When she tried to strike back against the hags, they sealed her in the shrine, hoping that its great mirrors would turn her to stone. For fear of petrifying herself, Sylvarie destroyed the shrine's mirrors.

Sylvarie attacks characters who descend into this area, believing they have been sent by the hags to torment her. A character can use an action to try to convince Sylvarie to stand down, first by making the party's good intentions clear and next by succeeding on a DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check. If a truce is achieved, Sylvarie blindfolds herself with a strip of cloth so that the characters aren't {@condition petrified} by her gaze accidentally. She removes the blindfold if she is forced to defend herself.

The curse that transformed Sylvarie doesn't end until her portrait in {@area area T18|247|x} is destroyed. The painting's destruction has the added benefit of restoring Sylvarie's neutral good alignment, whereupon she offers to do everything she can to help the party rid the temple of the evil creatures infesting it. If the characters destroyed Sylvarie's painting before coming here, they encounter Sylvarie in her true form: a neutral good moon elf {@creature priest} who is not wearing armor (AC 10). In this case, she is weeping by the pool and grateful to be free of the hags' curse.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Submerged in the pool is {@item Radiance|CM}, a {@item +1 wand of the war mage} in the form of an exquisite golden hand mirror. While surrounded by darkness, it sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. A creature that is attuned to Radiance can use a bonus action while holding the mirror to cast the {@spell enhance ability} spell, chosing itself and no other creature as the spell's target. Once this property of the wand is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn. The wand is Sylvarie's, but she offers it to the characters as a reward for ending her curse.

images.title: Map 7.2: Temple of the Restful Lily—Tower Floors

entries.name: T13–T18. Tower

entries: A finely crafted stone tower rises among the trees not far from the bathhouse. A statue of a sharp-featured winged elf crouches above the front door, whose bright red surface is decorated with golden swirls.

The door is locked. The elf statue over the door is a {@creature gargoyle} servant of the hags, wrapped in illusion magic (see "{@area Coven Minions|207|x}" earlier in the adventure). It watches the door but makes no move unless the characters go inside, whereupon it flies off to report to one of the hags.

entries.name: T13. Tower Foyer

entries: This foyer has a central spiral staircase leading up. The staircase is flanked by two closed doors, each one set in the middle of a stone wall. A thin, weak-looking dragonborn is feebly trying to sweep the floor here with a well-worn broom.

The cursed dragonborn, Gorba Daardenrian (see "{@area Coven Victims|20c|x}" earlier in the adventure), is so weak that she can barely hold her broom. When she sees the characters, she desperately tries to make them leave so she doesn't get into trouble. In the time she has spent at the temple, she has learned what happened to Sylvarie and knows the layout of the tower, but she will not share that information unless her fear of the characters can be overcome with roleplaying, a successful DC 20 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, or suitable magic.
Both the doors in this area are locked, and Gorba does not have the keys to them.

entries.name: T14. Saeth's Room
entries: Saeth carries the key that opens the locked door to this room.
This luxurious room has a large bed covered with rich silk sheets. A wardrobe and a dresser with a mirror stand against the walls.
The dresser has clothes scattered across it but holds nothing of value.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Characters who search the wardrobe find a suit of {@item scale mail|PHB} armor customized for a wearer with a tail, and a pair of {@item Shortsword|PHB|shortswords} ornately scribed with Infernal glyphs (50 gp each).

entries.name: T15. Tower Studio
entries: The three hags carry the only keys to this room.
Magical light illuminates this room, which has an oversized chair, heavy curtains covering the windows, and a large, ornate wooden chest.

Any characters who requested special magical treatments from one of the three sisters are brought to this room. The other sisters arrive in a few minutes, and they explain that all three working together can guarantee a greater possibility that the magic sought by the character can be channeled successfully. Characters who allow the sisters to work their magic can watch them labor together to create a cursed painting.

entries.name: Tools and Supplies
entries: The wooden chest is locked. As an action, a character can try to pick the lock using thieves' tools, doing so with a successful DC 18 Dexterity check, or break open the chest with a successful DC 20 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

Inside the chest are the materials the hags use for creating cursed paintings, including three blank canvases and paints infused with demon ichor. A character who examines the canvas determines that it is made of humanoid skin with a successful DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine} or {@skill Perception}) check. Physically touching the canvas grants advantage on the check. The paints appear normal unless examined closely by a character who has proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion} skill, whereupon their fiendish nature becomes clear.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The canvases are worth 200 gp each and the paints are worth 100 gp in total, though finding a buyer for such vile materials might be a challenge.

entries.name: T16. Tower Kitchen

entries: A dank scent fills the air in this well-used kitchen. Three tables stand in the room, one of which is covered in various vegetables and strange-looking cuts of meat. A wood stove burns brightly against the far wall, and a statue of a winged elf stands in the corner, its face carved into an open-mouthed smile.
An elderly dwarf stands before the stove, his hands trembling as he tries to lift a heavy iron pot.

This kitchen is normally used by the coven's scarecrow minions to prepare meals for the hags and Saeth, but it now has a new servant in Falthrax Loderr, the cursed Candlekeep acolyte. The central staircase leads to the upper floors, and an unlocked door leads to area T17.

Falthrax (see "{@area Coven Victims|20c|x}" earlier in the adventure) uses the {@creature commoner} stat block and panics at the sight of intruders. He warns the characters that they should leave immediately while trying to appear loyal to the hags for the benefit of the {@creature gargoyle} disguised as the elf statue, which has been placed here by the hags to watch over the coven's latest victim.

If the characters try to go upstairs or ask too many questions of Falthrax, the gargoyle attacks. If it is reduced to half its hit points or fewer, it flees by smashing out a window and tries to alert the hags.

If the gargoyle's threat is ended, Falthrax breaks down, revealing his identity if the characters haven't already sussed it out. He is desperate to have the curse undone so he can return to Candlekeep. Having just arrived at the temple, Falthrax can describe only the studio where his portrait was painted ({@area area T15|23f|x}) and the room where he sleeps along with the other curse victims presently held at the temple (area T17).

entries.name: T17. Victims' Quarters

entries: Piles of straw and moth-eaten blankets have been set up in this area as rough beds, and broken furniture and garbage is scattered around. In contrast to the squalor, four fine paintings hang along the curved outer wall. Each one is hauntingly beautiful—but also strangely unnerving to look upon.

Three of the victims of the hags' curse sleep and eat in this miserable chamber, forced to stare at the paintings that have caused their downfall. The fourth painting is the one that was done for Sylvarie Silversong ten years before. Each painting depicts its victim as the person they sought to become through their bargain with the hags:

items: A brawny, female, golden-scaled dragonborn warrior engaged in battle (Gorba Daardenrian)
A tall male tiefling with sparkling violet eyes wearing many fine jewels (Glitter)
A youthful male shield dwarf dancing at a feast (Falthrax Loderr)
A radiant female moon elf gazing upon her own reflection (Sylvarie)

entries: If the characters don't yet know the significance of the paintings but have met Glitter in {@area area T9|228|x}, Gorba in {@area area T13|23a|x}, or Falthrax in area T16, any character who studies the paintings recognizes that the paintings depict those individuals.

entries.name: T18. Hags' Lair

entries: The air grows cooler as you near the top of the tower, and it carries a putrid scent. What might once have been an elegant bedroom has long since been soiled and ruined. Murals of Sune that lined the walls have been defaced with dirt and filth.

Three beds are covered in moldy blankets and animal furs, including one topped by a canopy of giant bones and reeking, untanned hides. Empty crates are scattered throughout the room like furniture, holding broken weapons, moldering clothing, and other odd objects.
The top floor of the tower has been turned into the lair of the Fetid Gaze. Each of the three hags has its own disgusting bed, and the strange objects that fill the crates are shared by all.

entries.name: Glyph of Warding
entries: Scratched into the floor at the top of the stairs is a glyph created by a {@spell glyph of warding} spell. The hags use this glyph to eliminate intruders. It can be detected with a successful DC 13 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check and triggers when any creature except the hags or their minions passes over it. When triggered, the glyph splashes acid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on it—big enough to splatter the whole room and the central staircase, top to bottom. This sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@dice 5d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Dark Mementos
entries: The objects in the crates are souvenirs claimed from the hags' victims over ten years, including weapons, clothing, personal effects, tools, letters, trinkets, and more.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Most of the hags' mementos are worthless, but a search of the room turns up a {@item spell scroll} of {@spell clairvoyance} in a leather scroll case that has so far escaped destruction.

entries.name: Conclusion
entries: Once the threat of the hags and their servants is dealt with, the characters have a chance to rectify the dark deeds done at the temple.

Destroying the four portraits in {@area area T17|245|x} frees Gorba Daardenrian, Glitter, Falthrax Loderr, and Sylvarie Silversong from the hags' curse. (See "{@area Destroying the Paintings|20b|x}" earlier in the adventure for more information.) Gorba and Glitter are eternally grateful to the characters and might become lifelong allies of the party, at your discretion.

entries.name: Falthrax's Resolve
entries: With the curse lifted, Falthrax Loderr is ready to return to Candlekeep. The experience of having sought and then rejected a magical return to youth has taught him much about focusing on the positive aspects of his life and his service to knowledge. Though his struggles aren't over, a new inner resolve promises to leave him in a better position to face those struggles.

entries.name: Sylvarie's Decision
entries: Ten years under the effect of the hags' curse have left Sylvarie Silversong a changed person. As you see fit, she might be determined to restore the Temple of the Restful Lily to its former stature, refurbishing the shrine and making the site an even stronger place for the worship of Sune. Alternatively, she might decide that the temple holds too many dark memories for her, and that it should be up to others—perhaps the characters—to take charge of restoring the site. Either way, Sylvarie is grateful to the characters for what they've done and becomes a friend to the party for life.

data.name: Book of Cylinders

items: {@b An Adventure for 6th-level Characters}
{@b Developed & Edited by Kim Mohan}
{@b Written by Graeme Barber}

entries: Fifteen years ago, the {@i Book of Cylinders} fell into the hands of the archivists and librarians of Candlekeep as part of a collection of works recovered from a ruined keep in Tethyr, far to the south. It describes a conflict between a settlement of grippli (froglike humanoids distantly related to bullywugs) and an invading force of yuan-ti. The explorers who found the Book of Cylinders and bore it safely to Candlekeep claimed it wasn't a historical account, but a warning of dire events yet to unfold.

entries.name: Beginning the Adventure
entries: While the characters are conducting research or relaxing in Candlekeep, a member of the Avowed approaches them with a book and a quest:

A robed dragonborn clears her throat as she approaches you. Cradled in her arms is a green book. "Please forgive the interruption," she says. "My name is Pelk, and I speak for the Avowed. You're adventurers, are you not?"

Pelk is a dragonborn {@creature commoner} of copper dragon ancestry and a member of the Avowed. Her superiors have authorized her to brief the characters on a situation requiring their unique talents:

"Candlekeep has long relied on a community of grippli to the north for fresh seafood. These frogfolk capture and raise giant crabs as livestock in an offshore cluster of pens they have erected just outside their village, then trade the meat and other salvageable parts for items they can use, particularly those made of metal or glass. Candlekeep has long been a steady customer, but over the last several tendays the grippli have become less and less active, and the supply of food has been all but cut off. To make things worse, rumors have arisen about serpent creatures being seen near the Cloakwood and the grippli village."

Pelk tells the characters that this news came by way of Mitor Jans, a ship captain who makes a living transporting crab meat to Candlekeep. Pelk also reveals that Jans, eager for shipments to resume, has volunteered to take adventurers by sea to a trading post where they can meet with the grippli leader-in-exile, if they decide to undertake the quest to help the frogfolk.
Pelk informs the characters that the Avowed are willing to pay 500 gp to each character once the threat to the grippli village is neutralized.

entries.name: Opening the Book
entries: If the characters agree to undertake the quest, Pelk hands them the {@i Book of Cylinders} and says:
"This book was brought to Candlekeep several years ago. The explorers who found it claimed it was not a historical text, but a warning. My superiors have authorized me to show it to you."

Pelk allows the characters to inspect the book. It is surprisingly light, and brief examination shows it to be a cunningly contrived container. Its covering is made of supple leather reinforced with thicker strips of hide. Opening the cover reveals three intricately carved, hollow wooden cylinders and a linen bag of dry clay artfully decorated with a drop of water.

The outside of each cylinder is covered with writing and simple images, apparently telling a story in three parts. If the characters can't figure out what the cylinders have to say, Pelk or another staff member at Candlekeep can give them instructions.

The first step is to remove some of the clay from its bag and mix it with water to form a thick paste, then spread the wet clay in a thin layer on a flat surface. Rolling one of the cylinders across this surface presses the writing into the clay and makes it readable. After repeating the process for each of the cylinders, the characters have the full story and can use that knowledge to determine what they do next.
The impressions in the clay are mostly characters in the Dwarvish script, combined with simple pictographs that tell a tale about the frogfolk and the serpentfolk.

The first cylinder shows and explains how the grippli became skilled at harvesting giant crabs, which are loaded onto seagoing vessels and taken away while the frogfolk celebrate their newly earned wealth.

The second cylinder's story begins with serpent creatures lurking ominously outside the grippli village. Then the serpentfolk rush forth, capturing or killing any of the frogfolk who try to stand against them. As the village falls into disarray, the giant crabs escape from their cages and head back into the sea.

The third cylinder depicts, and briefly tells about, the aftermath of the serpentfolk's assault. The village is vacant, most of its buildings flattened. Still standing is the grippli's temple to their deity, which has been taken over by the snake creatures.

Unbeknownst to the characters at this time, the ancient story told on the cylinders is unfolding now. Evil yuan-ti are tormenting the grippli, and their goal is nothing less than the obliteration of all who stand in their way.

entries.name: Learning More
entries: After the characters have deciphered the story told on the cylinders, they can learn more about the context of the situation by talking to Pelk or other members of the Avowed. The following information can be learned:

items: Before communications with the grippli tapered off, people who returned to Candlekeep from a trip to the grippli trading post reported that a small band of yuan-ti had taken up residence at an old temple site where the grippli village used to be located. These serpentfolk, unlike others of their kind, are friendly toward the grippli, and the frogfolk are helping them excavate the location.

One of the last people from Candlekeep to depart from the grippli trading post reports that the place has been overrun by frogfolk fleeing their village, which was invaded by a second group of yuan-ti. These monsters are vicious and cruel, the exact opposite of the earlier visitors.

entries.name: Northward Ho!
entries: It should be apparent to the characters, from whatever information they have gleaned, that the grippli trading post is the first stop on their mission. The trading post is on the coast, due west of the Cloakwood and roughly 90 miles north-northwest of Candlekeep by sea. They can get there either by accepting Mitor Jans's offer of transportation, or by a longer overland route that takes them east, north, and then westward through the forest.

entries.name: Sea Voyage
entries: If the characters need further persuasion, Mitor Jans tells them that he and his ship, the {@i Dog Ear}, have made the trip from Candlekeep to the trading post and back again more times than he can count. He and his crew know exactly where to sail to avoid undersea hazards and stay on the most efficient route. If the characters are suspicious of Mitor's motives, a successful DC 10 Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check is all it takes to verify the truth of his claims.
In fact, this is the faster of the two routes. The trip takes a day and a half (36 hours), with no encounters en route.

entries.name: Mitor Jans
entries: {@i Neutral good half-orc}

Mitor (use the {@creature bandit captain} stat block, if necessary) joined Candlekeep as a young acolyte but soon found he was more suited to a life on the sea. His greatest source of pride is the book he has written about fish anatomy, which includes a detailed examination of sahuagin biology. He is willing to transport the party, but neither he nor his crew will join in a fight.

entries.name: Overland Voyage
entries: If the characters decline the sea voyage, they can consult a map at Candlekeep that shows the safest and fastest overland route, starting with the Way of the Lion, the road that leads inland (east) from Candlekeep. That road intersects with the Coast Way, which runs north along the eastern edge of the Cloakwood. About 50 miles north along the Coast Way is a trail that runs west into the forest and eventually leads to the outskirts of the {@area grippli village|262|x}. This route, well over 100 miles in total, takes at least seven days to traverse by foot, and at the end of it the characters will be entering the village before they visit the trading post. Both of those facts might have a marked effect on how the adventure continues (at your discretion). In addition, you might pit the characters against some random encounters along the way, to hint at the error of their ways in turning down the sea voyage.

entries.name: Helping the Grippli
entries: The grippli of the Cloakwood are distrustful of strangers but forced by circumstances to consider outside help. The warriors of the village and its leader, Pond Mother, are doing all they can to protect the grippli who have taken refuge at the trading post, and they cannot mount a counterattack against the evil yuan-ti, who have already killed several grippli for trying to stand up to them.

Assuming the characters traveled by ship to reach the trading post, the grippli guarding the dock watch them carefully but don't speak right away. Grippli have difficulty voicing the language of humans, so they speak in Primordial. (Mitor Jans has some fluency in Primordial and offers to be an intermediary if needed.) As long as the characters are nonhostile, the grippli will allow them to disembark.

Mitor Jans and his ship remain at the dock while the characters go ashore. He suggests that they seek an audience with the grippli's leader, Pond Mother, to learn firsthand about what has happened. (Fortunately for the characters, she's not hard to find.)

entries.name: Trading Post

entries: As the coastal mist clears, you get your first good look at the grippli trading post. Ramshackle shelters are clustered around a large permanent building. The low rumble of many voices softly croaking can be heard as your ship pulls up to the dock, where grippli bearing weapons are waiting to meet its passengers.

The central structure of the trading post is a fortified stone and mud-brick edifice, decorated with the preserved carapaces and claws of giant crabs, where commerce is normally conducted. The ground around it, usually clear of construction, now houses a host of makeshift dwellings, and business has slowed to a standstill. The place looks and feels more like a refugee encampment than a trading post.

The primitive shelters are the new homes of grippli who escaped when the evil yuan-ti came through the village in their search for the earlier group of serpentfolk. All these individuals are noncombatants, with no particular knowledge to be gained by communicating with them.

entries.name: Pond Mother Speaks
entries: The village's leader, who holds the title of Pond Mother, is an aged {@creature grippli warrior|CM} (see {@area the end of the adventure|273|x} for her stat block stat block). She evacuated the village when most of the other residents did and has set up quarters inside the large building. Assuming the characters are cooperative, the grippli guards take the visitors directly to her. If the party seems trustworthy, she speaks to them. She prefers Primordial (it's easier on grippli vocal cords) to address outsiders, but she can speak Common if there are no Primordial speakers in the group.

She informs the party that a small band of yuan-ti arrived in the area over a month ago, claiming to be followers of a benevolent deity they called the Scaled Mother. They were friendly, the opposite of other yuan-ti that the grippli had encountered and fought with. These yuan-ti expressed interest in excavating and restoring the previous site of the grippli village, a mile from its present location. Pond Mother saw no reason to refuse them, since their motives were seemingly innocent. But then, two tendays afterward, another group of yuan-ti came on the scene. These yuan-ti attacked the village, killed any frogfolk who tried to resist, and captured the grippli who weren't able to escape.

She asks the characters for help, telling them that the yuan-ti have been eating their eggs and tormenting the few grippli who remain in the village. Nothing has been heard from the friendly yuan-ti since the larger force of evil ones descended on the village. Pond Mother fears that either they have been disposed of, or they have been imprisoned in the old temple that lies north of the village. In any event, saving the eggs, or as many of them as possible, is the grippli's main concern.

If the characters demand payment, Pond Mother can offer the modest contents of the trading post's coffers (200 gp) for clearing out the village and safeguarding the eggs. She points out that the characters are also entitled to keep any items of value that don't belong to the villagers.

The trading post is about 5 miles south of the grippli village, which is most easily reached by sea. (An overland trip along the marshy coastline is a fool's route, fraught with obstacles and perils.) Mitor Jans will transport the characters as far as he can, then drop them off just outside the crab maze that borders the community before turning back south.

entries.name: Crab Maze
